trans-unit.source: Operational Insights Log Search API
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights Log Search API

trans-unit.source: Provides an overview of the Operational Insights Search API and includes examples that show you how to use it.
trans-unit.target: Provides an overview of the Operational Insights Search API and includes examples that show you how to use it.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights Search API overview and reference
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights Search API overview and reference

trans-unit.source: This guide provides a basic tutorial describing how you can use the Operational Insights Log Search API and it provides examples that show you how to use the commands.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides a basic tutorial describing how you can use the Operational Insights Log Search API and it provides examples that show you how to use the commands.

trans-unit.source: Overview of the Log Search API
trans-unit.target: Overview of the Log Search API

trans-unit.source: The Operational Insights Log Search API is RESTful and can be accessed via the Azure Resource Manager API.
trans-unit.target: The Operational Insights Log Search API is RESTful and can be accessed via the Azure Resource Manager API.

trans-unit.source: In this document you will find examples where the API is accessed through the <link><linkText>ARMClient</linkText><title></title></link>, an open source command line tool that simplifies invoking the Azure Resource Manager API.
trans-unit.target: In this document you will find examples where the API is accessed through the <link><linkText>ARMClient</linkText><title></title></link>, an open source command line tool that simplifies invoking the Azure Resource Manager API.

trans-unit.source: The use of ARMClient and PowerShell is one of many options to access the Operational Insights Log Search API.
trans-unit.target: The use of ARMClient and PowerShell is one of many options to access the Operational Insights Log Search API.

trans-unit.source: With these tools you can utilize the RESTful Azure Resource Manager API to make calls to Operational Insights workspaces and perform search commands within them.
trans-unit.target: With these tools you can utilize the RESTful Azure Resource Manager API to make calls to Operational Insights workspaces and perform search commands within them.

trans-unit.source: The API will output search results to you in JSON format, allowing you to use the search results in many different ways programmatically.
trans-unit.target: The API will output search results to you in JSON format, allowing you to use the search results in many different ways programmatically.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Resource Manager can be used via a <link><linkText>Library for .NET</linkText><title></title></link> as well as a <link><linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Resource Manager can be used via a <link><linkText>Library for .NET</linkText><title></title></link> as well as a <link><linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Review the liked web pages to learn more.
trans-unit.target: Review the liked web pages to learn more.

trans-unit.target: To use the ARM Client

trans-unit.target: To perform a simple search using the ARMClient

trans-unit.target: Login to your Microsoft or OrgID account:

trans-unit.source: armclient login
trans-unit.target: armclient login

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the properties that are available.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the properties that are available.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: name
trans-unit.target: name

trans-unit.source: Field name.
trans-unit.target: Field name.

trans-unit.source: displayName
trans-unit.target: displayName

trans-unit.source: The display name of the field.
trans-unit.target: The display name of the field.

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The Type of the field value.
trans-unit.target: The Type of the field value.

trans-unit.source: facetable
trans-unit.target: facetable

trans-unit.source: Combination of current ‘indexed’, ‘stored ‘and ‘facet’ properties.
trans-unit.target: Combination of current ‘indexed’, ‘stored ‘and ‘facet’ properties.

trans-unit.source: display
trans-unit.target: display

trans-unit.source: Current ‘display’ property.
trans-unit.target: Current ‘display’ property.

trans-unit.source: True if field is visible in search.
trans-unit.target: True if field is visible in search.

trans-unit.source: ownerType
trans-unit.target: ownerType

trans-unit.source: Reduced to only Types belonging to onboarded IP’s.
trans-unit.target: Reduced to only Types belonging to onboarded IP’s.

trans-unit.source: Optional parameters
trans-unit.target: Optional parameters

trans-unit.source: The following information describes optional parameters available.
trans-unit.target: The following information describes optional parameters available.

trans-unit.source: Highlighting
trans-unit.target: Highlighting

trans-unit.source: The “Highlight” parameter is an optional parameter you may use to request the search subsystem include a set of markers in its response.
trans-unit.target: The “Highlight” parameter is an optional parameter you may use to request the search subsystem include a set of markers in its response.

trans-unit.source: These markers indicate the start and end highlighted text that matches the terms provided in your search query.
trans-unit.target: These markers indicate the start and end highlighted text that matches the terms provided in your search query.

trans-unit.source: You may specify the start and end markers that will be used by search to wrap the highlighted term.
trans-unit.target: You may specify the start and end markers that will be used by search to wrap the highlighted term.
